Title: Realistic or Iconic 3D Animation (Adaptation Study with Theory Uncanny Valley)
Source title: ICSECC 2019 - International Conference on Sustainable Engineering and Creative Computing: New Idea, New Innovation, Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Visual Communication Design Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Limano, F., School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Visual Communication Design Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Animation has a significant and massive on the national economy reported by the UNESCO Institute for statistics show from 2005 to 2017. This phenomenon makes urgent need in society about good animation that can appeal to the audience, basically in 3D animation. The purpose of this study is to provide recommendations style for developing an animation work by comparing realistic or iconic 3D animation styles that can appeal to the audience. The study of this paper uses the qualitative method from secondary data in the previous study about uncanny valley style animation, and the author makes comparison study about good animation has appeal in society. The result of this research is expected into the recommendation production process for development 3D animated film between realistic and iconic style development. The conclusion of this research is that the iconic style is better than the realistic style for development 3D animation film, especially for the growing economy country. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: animation; appeal; iconic; production; realistic; uncanny valley
Index Keywords: Computation theory; Economics; Landforms; Motion pictures; Production; Sustainable development; appeal; Comparison study; iconic; National economy; Production process; Qualitative method; realistic; Uncanny valley; Animation

Title: Visual representation of character of wayang kulit purwa in the wayang-based games: Case studies of Kurusetra and Mahabarat warrior games
Source title: 2016 1st International Conference on Game, Game Art, and Gamification, ICGGAG 2016
Affiliations: Visual Communication Design, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kurnianto, A., Visual Communication Design, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Limano, F., Visual Communication Design, School of Design, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to determine how the visual character of wayang kulit (shadow puppet) represented into the wayang-themed game in Indonesia. Research using visual language theory with case studies of two wayang-themed games titled 'Mahabharat Warrior' and 'Kurusetra'. The theory of visual language is used to determine how the visual representation of the form of wayang that use the Space-Time-Plane (STP) system into the game character using the Naturalist-Perspectives-Momentopname (NPM) system. The results of this study indicate that the characters in the game have not been able to move the unique visual language of STP system using by the wayang to the visual language of NPM system in the game. While the symbolic aspects of the visual language, identities are becoming major important symbol of the wayang kulit characters which has revealed a visual uniqueness also cannot be represented to the visual character of the game. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: game; shadow puppets; visual language; wayang kulit
Index Keywords: Game theory; Case-studies; game; Indonesia; shadow puppets; Space time; Visual characters; Visual representations; wayang kulit; Visual languages
